channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: Palace: Enrollment in public schools to proceed on June 1
item.description: If the situation in the country has yet to reach “new normal” by August 24, classes will still proceed but will be conducted through “blended learning,” presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said.

item.title: 4 of 5 Filipinos went outside during first week of May amid lockdown — SWS
item.author: Bella Perez-Rubio
item.description: A Social Weather Station (SWS) survey found that four out of five Filipinos who were 15 years old or older left their houses in the first week of May.

item.title: WHO: COVID-19 cases in Philippines ‘not rapidly decreasing’ despite quarantine measures
item.author: Gaea Katreena Cabico
item.description: Dr. Takeshi Nishijima, WHO Western Pacific technical officer, stressed the importance of staying at home and practicing preventive measures as the country is set to further ease restrictions on movement after a nearly-three month lockdown.

item.title: Employers, DOLE reminded: Workers must freely consent to temporary wage, benefits adjustment
item.description: "DOLE must ensure that any reduction in wages that would be implemented by employers should be according to the guidelines it issued earlier this month," Villanueva said.

item.title: Coast guard frontliner passes away, 6 hurt in vehicular accident
item.description: The group was travelling from PCG District—Southern Tagalog in Sta. Clara, Batangas to the Ninoy Aquino International Airport when a tire of their multipurpose van burst while traversing STAR Tollway in Ibaan, Batangas.

item.title: Former PDEA chief Aaron Aquino transferred to Clark Airport
item.description: Presidential spokesperson Harry Roque said Aaron Aquino was appointed as a member of Clark International Airport Corporation board of directors last May 22.

item.title: Wilkins Villanueva appointed as new PDEA chief
item.description: In a Facebook post Tuesday, Villanueva expressed his gratitude to the chief executive “for giving me his trust and confidence to lead our country’s war on drugs.”

item.title: Project Kaagapay raises P92 million for healthcare frontliners
item.description: Project Kaagapay, a fundraising initiative that began last April to provide much-needed personal protective equipment for the country’s healthcare community, has raised almost P92 million in cash donations and received in-kind donations worth almost P27 million, reaching 70 hospitals and medical centers in Metro Manila and other provinces and distributing over 200,000 PPE sets for beneficiaries.

item.title: Transport coalition: Prioritize people’s mobility
item.author: Richmond Mercurio
item.description: A coalition advocating sustainable public transportation is asking the government to prioritize the safe mobility of people over the mobility of private motor vehicles in its transportation-related responses to coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic.

item.title: Experts, LGUs back healthcare system bills
item.author: Cecille Suerte Felipe
item.description: The Department of Health and Union of Local Authorities of the Philippines have expressed support for bills seeking to strengthen the country’s healthcare system, which were filed by Sen. Bong Go, chair of the committee on health and demography.
